intro: Erigeron semiovalis, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron semiovalis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of the chaparral and sagebrush ecosystems.
